intro: Ballantinia, commonly known as the common hollyhock, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and produces flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. Ballantinia has palmate leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly serrated edge. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
